chunks.en: Ask a question to experienced car owners. Is it better to buy a used Mazda CX-5 for about 80,000 yuan or a new Lavida? I don't drive to work (I haven't for the past few years), mainly for going back to my hometown, driving during holidays, with a 100+ kilometer highway trip, and with a child.
Not buying Qin 798 now is a waste of money.
Since you don't drive often, it's better to rent one when you need it~~

chunks.zh: ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆå›ç­”åˆ«äººçš„é—®é¢˜ï¼Œæ€»æ˜¯å–œæ¬¢æ‰©å±•å‡º N ä¸ªé—®é¢˜ä¸‹å¼•ï¼Ÿ    ä¸æ‡‚ã€‚      è½¦å†µå¥½çš„äºŒæ‰‹ CX-5 ï¼Œ         ä½ è¿™æƒ…å†µæ²¡å¿…è¦ä¹°æ–°è½¦ï¼Œ3 å¹´ä¸€æ¢ï¼Œéšå¿ƒæ‰€æ¬²ã€‚
chunks.en: Why do you always like to expand into N sub-questions when answering other people's questions? Don't understand. A used CX-5 in good condition. In your situation, there's no need to buy a new car; change it every 3 years, do whatever you want.

Renting a car is not feasible. During the Chinese New Year, everyone rents cars, and there may be no cars available. Here in Guilin, a Corolla costs 750 yuan per day, and it's not easy to rent. Renting for a week plus insurance would be more than 5,000 yuan. Renting a BMW would probably cost more than 10,000 yuan. Buying a car definitely won't be a loss. After having a car, you can travel around on weekends, and you will definitely drive when you need to go somewhere further and a taxi is expensive. It's 2024, does the CX-5 still have any product strength with its outdated technology? You haven't changed your car in 5 years, you should definitely buy new, not old.
Qin Plus
Go home and discuss with your wife, this question is asked in vain.
If you don't drive often and only use two tanks of gas a year, don't buy a car. High-speed rail and ride-sharing are good options.

@harlanXue #22 You can keep the money first and try renting for a year. However, when renting a car during holidays, I suggest renting for a couple of extra days and go there a day or two in advance to choose a car. Renting a car is a bit like opening a blind box; if you're late, the good ones will be rented by others.
I suggest a new car for the first purchase, for peace of mind.

chunks.en: Isn't this price point the positioning of Qin Plus? Of course, Lavida is also good, but it seems that Lavida costs nearly 100,000 yuan after landing. You can even buy a 120km Destroyer DMI.
New cars have depreciated a lot in recent years. It's better to buy a new car under 100,000 yuan. Didn't BYD just launch the 79,800 yuan Qin Plus?

chunks.zh: è¿™å°±æ˜¯ä¼ è¯´ä¸­çš„â€œä¸¤ç®±æ²¹â€ç©å®¶å—ï¼Ÿ ğŸ˜‚ä¸ªäººå»ºè®®ï¼šä¸ä¹°ï¼Œå›è€å®¶å‰ç§Ÿè¾†è½¦å°±å¥½ï¼Œå³ä½¿ä¸ç®—æ—¥å¸¸çš„å…»è½¦è´¹ç”¨ï¼Œä½ è‡ªå·±ç®—ç®—è¿™ 8 ä¸‡èƒ½ç§Ÿå¤šå°‘æ¬¡è½¦ã€å¤Ÿä½ ç”¨å‡ å¹´çš„å§ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚å¹¶ä¸”ç§Ÿè½¦çš„è¯ï¼Œä½ è¿˜å¯ä»¥æ ¹æ®è¡Œç¨‹å®‰æ’ã€å¸¦çš„ä¸œè¥¿å¤šå°‘å»é€‰æ‹©ä¸åŒçš„è½¦å‹ã€‚
chunks.en: So you're the legendary â€œtwo tanks of gasâ€ player? ğŸ˜‚ My personal suggestion: don't buy, just rent a car before going back to your hometown. Even without considering the daily car maintenance costs, calculate for yourself how many times you can rent a car with those 80,000 yuan and how many years it will last you... And when renting a car, you can also choose different models based on your itinerary and how much stuff you need to bring.
I suggest a new car. Someone will still make 15,000 yuan from a used car; it's not as good as a new car.

There are a total of one hundred and six people in our group, and there is also a dog group owner. Everyone agrees that you should rent a BMW to go home when you need it. If you buy a car, you need to bear a series of hidden costs, such as maintenance, insurance, fixed parking space, car washing, temporary parking, and minor accidents. Of course, if you want to buy one, you can buy a Tesla and use my referral code: https://www.tesla.cn/referral/ahaxzh47881
So you are the legendary two-tanks-of-gas army...
byd798, no need to charge, just use it as a gas car. Those who talk about renting a car, most haven't rented a car during the Chinese New Year.
Those who talk about renting cars, probably haven't rented a car during the holidays. A Lavida for more than 10 days during Chinese New Year, 8,000 yuan may not be enough.
I suggest buying a CX-5. Since you have a child, you will definitely want to take your child out to play. The 2.0 is enough.

chunks.zh: CX5 2.5 å››é©±çš„è€è½¦ä¸»ï¼Œå»å¹´æ¢äº† BRZ ï¼ŒCX5 ç»™æˆ‘çˆ¸å¼€äº†ï¼Œè¿™è½¦çš„å˜é€Ÿç®±æ˜¯çœŸçš„èªæ˜ä¸è¿‡è½¦å­æ”¾ç€å®¹æ˜“åï¼Œæ¯”å¦‚è¦å®šæ—¶ä¿å…»ï¼Œè¿˜å¾—æ¯å¹´å‡ åƒå—çš„ä¿é™©ï¼Œæœºæ²¹ï¼Œå˜é€Ÿç®±æ²¹ï¼Œåˆ¹è½¦æ²¹ï¼Œåè½´å·®é€Ÿé”æ²¹ç­‰ç­‰ã€‚è¿˜æœ‰è½®èƒä¸èƒ½æ”¾ï¼Œå®¹æ˜“å½¢å˜è€Œåæ‰ï¼Œè€Œä¸”è½®èƒæœ¬èº«ä¹Ÿæœ‰å¯¿å‘½ï¼Œ5-6 å¹´å°±å¾—æ¢ï¼Œä¸ç„¶ä¸Šé«˜é€Ÿä½ ä¹Ÿå¾ˆéš¾æ”¾å¿ƒï¼Œçˆ†èƒå¯ä¸æ˜¯å¼€ç©ç¬‘çš„ï¼Œæˆ‘çš„ CX5 ç»™æˆ‘çˆ¸ä¹‹å‰æ¢äº† 4 æ¡ç±³å…¶æ—çš„ PS4 ï¼Œä¸€æ¡ä¸€åƒï¼Œä¹°å…¶ä»–ä¾¿å®œç‚¹çš„ä¹Ÿè¦ 700 å·¦å³ã€‚è½¦å­æ¯å‘¨æœ€å¥½å¼€ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œè®©æœºæ²¹åŠ¨èµ·æ¥ï¼Œä¸ç„¶å®¹æ˜“æ²‰ç§¯ã€‚å»ºè®®ä½ è¦ç”¨è½¦çš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œç§Ÿä¸€è¾†å¥½äº†ï¼Œè´¹ç”¨å¯èƒ½æ¯”ä½ å…»ä¸€å¹´è½¦è¿˜ä¾¿å®œï¼Œä¸è¿‡æˆ‘ç¡®å®ä¹Ÿæ²¡è¿‡å¹´ç§Ÿè¿‡è½¦ï¼Œå¾—ç»¼åˆçœ‹çœ‹ã€‚
chunks.en: An old CX-5 2.5 4WD owner. Last year, I switched to a BRZ, and my dad is driving the CX-5. The transmission of this car is really smart, but cars are prone to breaking down if they sit unused. For example, you need regular maintenance, and you have to pay thousands of yuan for insurance, engine oil, transmission oil, brake oil, rear axle differential lock oil, etc., every year. Also, the tires can't be left idle; they are prone to deformation and damage. And tires have a lifespan; they need to be replaced every 5-6 years, otherwise, you won't feel at ease on the highway. A blowout is no joke. Before I gave my CX-5 to my dad, I replaced it with 4 Michelin PS4 tires, one costs a thousand yuan. Buying other cheaper ones also costs about 700 yuan. It's best to drive the car once a week to get the engine oil moving, otherwise, it's prone to sediment. I suggest you rent a car when you need to use one; the cost may be cheaper than keeping a car for a year. However, I haven't rented a car during Chinese New Year either; you have to consider everything.
